introduction: An editorial on the COVID-19 epidemic summarizes the current knowledge about the disease and the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus. In particular, characteristics of the virus and treatment options are addressed. 278–280

Strongyloidiasis prevalence is high in migrants coming from endemic areas living in Spain. Screening and treating this infection among this population is an effective strategy to prevent severe complications. 281–290

Original Research Papers: Certain geographic clusters of HIV have persisted in Ethiopia over the last 10 years. Each cluster has unique risk factors that can be targeted to address HIV in the country. 301–307

Significant efforts are needed to increase ART coverage among HIVpositive Men who have Sex with Men with high CD4 counts in China. Although prevalence of missing ART doses is low, non-compliance with dosing schedules or instructions should not be neglected. 308–318

Gene transcript analysis revealed significant up-regulation of Collagen type III vs. Collagen type I in fibrotic skin biopsies of limb nodules from lymphoedema patients. Histopathological and immunohistochemical analysis also revealed enhancement of Collagen types I and III in fibrotic vs. normal skin. These preliminary findings indicate the potentially significant involvement of Collagen type III in grade-3 lymphoedema patients’ development of fibrotic skin. 319–327

In Ethiopia, improving community awareness of antenatal care, employing female health professionals and culturally adapted guidelines could improve skilled delivery utilization. In a patriarchal society, involving male partners in all maternal health issues is essential to increase use of maternal health services and to decrease maternal mortality. 328–337

The tuberculosis epidemic in Brazil is determined by access to health services, especially the provision of HIV testing among those diagnosed with tuberculosis, accelerated urbanization with large pockets of poverty, and unsanitary housing conditions, corroborating global trends. 338–345

A longitudinal, retrospective study of the TB program in Lima, Peru reveals partial compliance with TB contact investigation and identifies factors related to contact persons, index cases and health facilities that affect the start and completion of Isoniazid Preventive Therapy. These can guide the TB program in increasing its coverage and quality. 346–356

Neglecting the impact of diagnostic performance may lead to BIAS in RCTs. Evidence standards for diagnostic methods and drugs should be comparable. Diagnostic methods should be characterized in the study protocol. 357–363

For treatment of congenital toxoplasmosis, sulfadiazine suspension (100 mg/mLÀ1) in simple syrup may be the most suitable formulation because it remains stable for 14 days at room temperature, providing an alternative liquid dosage form for children. 364–372

In China, the proportion of tuberculosis patients with unfavourable treatment outcomes increases with smear-negative pulmonary TB, extrapulmonary TB and diabetes mellitus. TB programmes need to ensure early detection of diabetes and intensive patient support to those at risk. 373–379
Experimental infections in volunteers are a tool to test drugs and vaccines, and they show that ivermectin has no effect on the liver stages of the malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum. 380–386

summary: An editorial on the COVID-19 epidemic summarizes the current knowledge about the disease and the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus.
Characteristics of the virus and treatment options are addressed.
Screening and treating this infection among this population is an effective strategy to prevent severe complications.
C-reactive protein is readily available at point-ofcare and could help healthcare workers identifying febrile patients with a bacterial infection.
Certain geographic clusters of HIV have persisted in Ethiopia over the last 10 years.
Each cluster has unique risk factors that can be targeted to address HIV in the country.
Significant efforts are needed to increase ART coverage among HIVpositive Men who have Sex with Men with high CD4 counts in China.
Prevalence of missing ART doses is low, non-compliance with dosing schedules or instructions should not be neglected.
Gene transcript analysis revealed significant up-regulation of Collagen type III vs Collagen type I in fibrotic skin biopsies of limb nodules from lymphoedema patients.
Histopathological and immunohistochemical analysis revealed enhancement of Collagen types the author ands III in fibrotic vs normal skin.
These preliminary findings indicate the potentially significant involvement of Collagen type III in grade-3 lymphoedema patients’ development of fibrotic skin.
In a patriarchal society, involving male partners in all maternal health issues is essential to increase use of maternal health services and to decrease maternal mortality.

The tuberculosis epidemic in Brazil is determined by access to health services, especially the provision of HIV testing among those diagnosed with tuberculosis, accelerated urbanization with large pockets of poverty, and unsanitary housing conditions, corroborating global trends.

A longitudinal, retrospective study of the TB program in Lima, Peru reveals partial compliance with TB contact investigation and identifies factors related to contact persons, index cases and health facilities that affect the start and completion of Isoniazid Preventive Therapy.
These can guide the TB program in increasing its coverage and quality.
Neglecting the impact of diagnostic performance may lead to BIAS in RCTs. Evidence standards for diagnostic methods and drugs should be comparable.
Diagnostic methods should be characterized in the study protocol.
364–372 In China, the proportion of tuberculosis patients with unfavourable treatment outcomes increases with smear-negative pulmonary TB, extrapulmonary TB and diabetes mellitus.
TB programmes need to ensure early detection of diabetes and intensive patient support to those at risk.
Experimental infections in volunteers are a tool to test drugs and vaccines, and they show that ivermectin has no effect on the liver stages of the malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum.

Introduction: An editorial on the COVID-19 epidemic summarizes the current knowledge about the disease and the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus.
Characteristics of the virus and treatment options are addressed.
Screening and treating this infection among this population is an effective strategy to prevent severe complications.
C-reactive protein is readily available at point-ofcare and could help healthcare workers identifying febrile patients with a bacterial infection.
Results: Certain geographic clusters of HIV have persisted in Ethiopia over the last 10 years.
Each cluster has unique risk factors that can be targeted to address HIV in the country.
Significant efforts are needed to increase ART coverage among HIVpositive Men who have Sex with Men with high CD4 counts in China.
Prevalence of missing ART doses is low, non-compliance with dosing schedules or instructions should not be neglected.
Gene transcript analysis revealed significant up-regulation of Collagen type III vs Collagen type I in fibrotic skin biopsies of limb nodules from lymphoedema patients.
Histopathological and immunohistochemical analysis revealed enhancement of Collagen types the author ands III in fibrotic vs normal skin.
These preliminary findings indicate the potentially significant involvement of Collagen type III in grade-3 lymphoedema patients’ development of fibrotic skin.
In a patriarchal society, involving male partners in all maternal health issues is essential to increase use of maternal health services and to decrease maternal mortality.

The tuberculosis epidemic in Brazil is determined by access to health services, especially the provision of HIV testing among those diagnosed with tuberculosis, accelerated urbanization with large pockets of poverty, and unsanitary housing conditions, corroborating global trends.

A longitudinal, retrospective study of the TB program in Lima, Peru reveals partial compliance with TB contact investigation and identifies factors related to contact persons, index cases and health facilities that affect the start and completion of Isoniazid Preventive Therapy.
These can guide the TB program in increasing its coverage and quality.
Neglecting the impact of diagnostic performance may lead to BIAS in RCTs. Evidence standards for diagnostic methods and drugs should be comparable.
Conclusion: Diagnostic methods should be characterized in the study protocol.
364–372 In China, the proportion of tuberculosis patients with unfavourable treatment outcomes increases with smear-negative pulmonary TB, extrapulmonary TB and diabetes mellitus.
TB programmes need to ensure early detection of diabetes and intensive patient support to those at risk.
Experimental infections in volunteers are a tool to test drugs and vaccines, and they show that ivermectin has no effect on the liver stages of the malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum.
